title: Maggie Gyllenhaal & Peter Sarsgaard make a gorgeous couple at the Nordstrom flagship opening in NYC
text:
They're a respected acting couple whose marriage has stood the test of time, and they crooked arms at Nordstrom's swanky event in rainy New York City on Tuesday night inspiring admiration from onlookers all around.

Maggie Gyllenhaal and Peter Sarsgaard, married since 2009 and together since earlier in the aughts, complemented each other beautifully at the flagship opening gala, with Maggie in an exquisite ensemble that included a metallic floral blazer, glittery ombre top, and iridescent taupe trousers.

Peter, 48, made the perfect arm candy, in a black bomber jacket, black slacks, and nearly matching taupe polo.

Exquisite ensemble: Maggie Gyllenhaal was radiant at Nordstrom's swanky event in rainy New York City on Tuesday night

Maggie, 41, shined in her outfit, wearing her subtly golden blazer with pink floral detailing over her shoulders.

Her loose-fitting sweetheart top underneath was covered in brilliant sequins that went from silver to gold.

Her slightly shiny, wide-legged trousers were cinched with a matching belt.

The Secretary star finished off the look with black boots and a black headband.

Gorgeous couple: Gyllenhaal and Peter Sarsgaard, married since 2009 and together since earlier in the aughts, complemented each other beautifully at the flagship opening gala

Maggie, older sister to Jake Gyllenhaal, saw her star rise alongside that of her brother, after the pair starred as onscreen siblings in the now classic sci-fi masterpiece Donnie Darko in 2001.

She broke big the following year with Golden Globe-nominated performance in the psycho-sexual black comedy Secretary, opposite James Spader.

Gyllenhaal has gone on to score rave reviews in practically every project she's chosen since, up to an including her turn as a porn star-turned-director in HBO's The Deuce, the third season of which is in the midst of wrapping up.

Coordinated: Peter made the perfect arm candy, in a black bomber jacket, black slacks, and nearly matching taupe polo, while Maggie sported a beautiful blazer with pink floral detailing

Iridescent: Her loose-fitting sweetheart top underneath was covered in brilliant sequins that went from silver to gold

Maggie's husband Peter has also consistently earned positive feedback for his acting catalog, which has spanned the spectrum from comic book fodder (Sarsgaard was arguably the best part of the 2011 Ryan Reynolds superhero vehicle Green Lantern) to searing dramas like Boys Don't Cry.

He has often played a chilling and convincing villain, as in the above-mentioned titles as well as the underrated 2005 chiller The Skeleton Key opposite Kate Hudson and Gena Rowlands.

The couple, who are parents to two daughters, are set to team on a new musical project, entitled Ready To Ride: A Musical Homecoming, which is currently in post-production.

Critical darlings: Maggie and Peter have both consistently earned positive feedback for their acting catalogs; seen here at the Irishman premiere in NYC last month
